RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARBERRY BANDIT away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of STANFORD NORTH in the run down the backstretch, continued to force the issue in the run down the backside and into the final turn, took control midway through the turn, and drew clear in the lane. MAX BOOSTER stalked the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid two wide from between rivals entering the final turn, and closed willingly from just off the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. STANFORD NORTH vied for the lead from the inside of BARBERRY BANDIT entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival midway through the turn, and faded in the late stages while holding on for a share. SHESBOURBONONICE broke sharply, but was taken in hand and allowed to settle at the back of the pack entering the backstretch, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid. HE'S A SAINT away well and tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, loomed a danger when engaging the leaders three wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Stanford North
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Shesbourbononice
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Max Booster
ENTRY.OWNER: Rocking Bar B Outfit Getson Larry and Getson Margaret
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed inside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. (PLUS UP TO $8,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DESIRED OUTCOME settled at the back of the pack while saving ground at the rail in the run to the first turn, began to advanced smartly from along the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside through the final turn, tipped three wide entering the lane, and closed determinedly from the outside of CROWN COUNCIL to get up in the final strides. CROWN COUNCIL broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of B C CHU CHU entering the first turn, forced the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, shook clear of his pace rival midway through the turn, and just failed to last, while proving clearly second best. ANDALEIGH away well and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to be up for a share. B C CHU CHU away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of CROWN COUNCIL in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival midway through the turn, and weakened in the late stages. STILETTOS ONLY stumbled in the opening strides, before rushing up three wide entering the first turn, and took a stalking trip into the backstretch, struggled to hold his position in the run to the final turn while dropping back to trail, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: B C Chu Chu
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Crown Council
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Desired Outcome
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, advanced 1/2, rallied inside, closed 2w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Andaleigh
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Stilettos Only
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, stalked 2 wide, through early

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FRANKIE MACHINE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, advanced from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, continued smartly from just off the rail entering he final turn, and closed determinedly from between rivals in deep stretch to get up in time. PADDY D'ORO stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, overtook the pacesetter while racing two wide into the final turn, and just failed to last. JUST MAKE BELIEVE away alertly and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and battled on gamely two out from the rail in the drive in a solid effort. DYNAMITER away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, battled from the inside of PADDY D'ORO entering the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on that rival through the turn, and weakened in the late stages. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER settled off the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, dropped back to trail in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. ACE DEUCE broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained his position into the backstretch, began to struggle to up in the run to the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Frankie Machine
ENTRY.OWNER: Willow Creek Farms and Chiesa Fabio
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, advanced 1/2, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, led, closed rail, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Ace Deuce
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1 ,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GROOVIN' IS BAK stalked the pacesetter into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive while drifting in slightly late to prevail. ENGLISH BAY TEDDY settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing four wide in the drive. BAK TO LIBERTY hopped slightly at the start, and trailed the field into the backstretch, commenced his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed one out from the rail in the lane, steadied briefly in deep stretch before splitting rivals to come up short. TIZ THE PROSPECT away alertly and rushed to a clear lead from along the rail entering the first turn, raced on an uncontested lead in the run down the backside, rallied along the rail entering the final turn, and gave way grudgingly late. AN ARMY OF LIGHT broke sharply and stalked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied four wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong while finished in the middle of the track. MILITARY CROSS away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two wide into the backstretch, pulled his way into a tracking trip approaching the final turn, but needed more when called upon. Following the running of this race the stewards conducted an inquiry into the stretch run. Following their review, the stewards disqualified GROOVIN' IS BACK from first and placed this horse third, for drifting in late and taking the path of BAK TO LIBERTY.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Groovin' Is Bak
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: An Army of Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Prospect
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, clear lead, rallied inside, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, steadied late

ENTRY.NAME: Military Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVAANY tracked the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed two out from the rail in the drive to get up in time. SHOWMAN tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, collared the leader while commencing a two wide bid entering he final turn, took command leaving the turn, and just failed to last. DAPPER DON stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive to get up for a share, while galloping out in front. STOLO SPIRIT was fractious prior to the start, and settled off the early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive. LILSISTERLEE away alertly and rushed to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside, battled from the inside of SHOWMAN entering the final turn, but weakened late. CAIRO CRUSADER was unprepared at the start, and was still in the hands of the assistant starter when the gates opened and trailed the field into the first turn, saved ground at the rail while launching his bid from the back of the pack entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive. DEANARROW stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. Following the running of this race the stewards conducted an inquiry into the start of the race. After review it was deemed that CAIRO CRUSADER did not receive a fair start, and ordered a full refund on this horse.

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, closed 4 wide, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Stolo Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, settled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Crusader
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, trailed, rallied rail, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Divaany
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Deanarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pr ice $12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAY FANTASTIC away well and was allowed to settle off a hotly contested pace entering the stretch the first time, maintained his position in the run down the backside, set sail after the tiring pacesetters entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and held ROOKIE YEAR safely at bay late to prove best. ROOKIE YEAR settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, held his position in the run down the backside, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive to hold the place. BROKE AN BROKEN away alertly and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, bided his time towards the rear of the field in the run down the backside, launched his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the inside in the drive to get up for a share. STAR ENTRY settled off the contested early pace while racing two out from the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and improved his position late while finishing four wide in the drive. SLOOP JOHN B broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, was quickly overtaken midway through the turn, and had nothing left for the lane. FOREIGN PROTOCOL settled off the early pace while racing three wide entering the stretch the first time, continued to bide his time well off the leaders in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. WISELY PLAYED was off a step slow and trailed the field through the stretch the first time, continued from the back of the pack in the run down the backside, rallied three wide into the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid. BUZZINGA KARMA rushed up to duel for the lead from the outside of SLOOP JOHN B entering the first turn, continued to battle for the lead from the outside of that rival through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch while well clear of the balance of the field, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was quickly engulfed midway through the final turn, and had nothing left for the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, rallied 3 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Rookie Year
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled inside, rallied 3w, led held

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign Protocol
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Buzzinga Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Star Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 3/8M Dirt CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $6,250 OR LESS OR CLAIMING PRICE $6,250. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 24A llowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $500 To $5,000 2 lbs. See Marathon series rules for eligibility. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ERLICH settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch the first time, raced into a stalking trip entering the stretch the second time, continued to save ground through the third turn and in the run down the final time, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, slipped through along the rail entering the lane to take charge, and inched clear late to prove best. SLEW'S DA BOSS unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, continued to bide his time at the back of the field through the stretch the second time, rallied smartly from just off the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the inside in the drive to get up for the place. FORT LANGLEY settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch the first time, moved into a stalking trip entering the second turn, maintained that position through the third turn and in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, and battled gamely three wide in the drive to garner a share. YOU DON'T OWN ME away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backside the first time, asserted himself as the leader through the stretch the second time, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn while drifting three wide, and finished willingly five wide in the drive in a game effort. ARTISTIC JEWLER settled towards the rear of the field entering the backstretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, moved into a stalking trip in a bunched up field in the run to the third turn, rallied smartly four wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three out from the rail in the drive. LAUGH WITH ME broke sharply and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained his tracking trip through the stretch the second time and in the run to the final turn, rallied along the rail entering the turn, took the lead leaving the turn while drifting off the rail, and was quickly tackled by ERLICH, was unable to match strides with that rival straightening for home, and was outfinished late. GORKY PARK stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position through the stretch the second time and in the run down the backside, began to struggle to keep up approaching the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. MAKEITORBREAKIT dueled for the lead while racing headstrong in the run down the backstretch the first time, eased himself into a stalking trip through the stretch the second time while saving ground, maintained a tracking trip to the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. DON WITH THE WIND stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch the first time, began to lose position while settling off the leaders through the stretch the second time, dropped back to trail in the run down the backstretch the final time and had nothing to offer late while not being persevered with in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Artistic Jewler
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh With Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied inside, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Da Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Mel Corsan Doug and Houweling Len
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2w, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Erlich
ENTRY.OWNER: Christoff, Gordon and Giesbrecht, Lance B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, led, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Don With the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Langley
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,
